    The Data Lake: Schema on Read

    Carl Boettiger

    2018-11-12

    datalake.Rmd
    library(virtuoso)
library(rdftools) # for write_nquads
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

    Tabular Data

    library(nycflights13)

    We start up our Virtuoso server, wait for it to come up, and then connect:

    myserver <- vos_start()
#> PROCESS 'virtuoso-t', running, pid 3136.
#> Server is now starting up, this may take a few seconds...
#> latest log entry: 16:00:32 Server online at 1111 (pid 3136)
Sys.sleep(5)
con <- vos_connect()

    We can represent any data as RDF with a little care. For instance, consider the nycflights13 data. First, we must represent any primary or foreign keys in any table must be as URIs and not literal integers or strings:

    uri_flights <- flights %>% 
  mutate(tailnum = paste0("planes:", tailnum),
         carrier = paste0("airlines:", carrier))

    We write the data.frames out as nquads. Recall that each cell of a data.frame can be represented as a triple, in which the column is the predicate, the primary key (or row number) the subject, and the cell value the object. We turn column names and primary keys into URIs using a prefix based on the table name. (Note that rdflib does this conversion by merely munging cells and calling write.table, it is not a standard redland library transform).

    write_nquads(airlines,  "airlines.nq", key = "carrier", prefix = "airlines:")
write_nquads(planes,  "planes.nq", key = "tailnum", prefix = "planes:")
write_nquads(uri_flights,  "flights.nq", prefix = "flights:")

    We’re ready to import all these triples. This may take a few minutes:

    system.time(
  vos_import(con, c("flights.nq", "planes.nq", "airlines.nq"))
)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.03    0.01  112.34

    The data from all three tables is now reduced into a single triplestore graph, one triple for each data point. Rather than joining tables, we can write SPARQL query that names the columns we want.

    query <- 
'SELECT  ?carrier ?name ?manufacturer ?model ?dep_delay
WHERE {
?flight <flights:tailnum>  ?tailnum .
?flight <flights:carrier>  ?carrier .
?flight <flights:dep_delay>  ?dep_delay .
?tailnum <planes:manufacturer> ?manufacturer .
?tailnum <planes:model> ?model .
?carrier <airlines:name> ?name
}'

system.time(
df <- vos_query(con, query)
)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    4.16    0.25   12.09

head(df)
#>       carrier                     name manufacturer     model dep_delay
#> 1 airlines:UA    United Air Lines Inc.       BOEING   757-224        -5
#> 2 airlines:EV ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      EMBRAER EMB-145XR       -10
#> 3 airlines:EV ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      EMBRAER EMB-145LR        -6
#> 4 airlines:EV ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      EMBRAER EMB-145XR        -2
#> 5 airlines:EV ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      EMBRAER EMB-145LR        -7
#> 6 airlines:UA    United Air Lines Inc.       BOEING   737-824        -3

    List Data

    Transform JSON (or list data) into triples. In this case, we have a large JSON blob (or R list) containing metadata on all rOpenSci packages:

    x <- jsonlite::read_json("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ropensci/roregistry/ex/codemeta.json")
write_nquads(x, "ropensci.nq", prefix = "http://schema.org/")

    And bulk-import

    vos_import(con, "ropensci.nq")

    Find all packages where “Carl Boettiger” is an “author”, and return: package name, license, and co-author surnames:

    query <-
"PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
SELECT DISTINCT ?package ?license ?coauthor
 WHERE {
 ?s schema:identifier ?package ;
    schema:author ?author ;
    schema:license ?license ;
    schema:name ?name ;
    schema:author ?coauth .
 ?author schema:givenName 'Carl' .
 ?author schema:familyName 'Boettiger' .
 ?coauth schema:familyName ?coauthor
}"

vos_query(con, query) %>% 
as_tibble() %>% 
mutate(license = basename(license)) # Tidy up URIs into names
#> # A tibble: 43 x 3
#>    package   license      coauthor 
#>    <chr>     <chr>        <chr>    
#>  1 rfigshare CC0-1.0      Hart     
#>  2 RNeXML    BSD-3-Clause Lapp     
#>  3 RNeXML    BSD-3-Clause Vos      
#>  4 rfigshare CC0-1.0      Ram      
#>  5 RNeXML    BSD-3-Clause Boettiger
#>  6 arkdb     MIT          Boettiger
#>  7 codemetar GPL-3.0      Boettiger
#>  8 piggyback GPL-3.0      Boettiger
#>  9 rdflib    MIT          Boettiger
#> 10 rdryad    MIT          Boettiger
#> # ... with 33 more rows
    query <-
  rdftools:::sparql_op() %>%
  rdftools:::select("identifier", "license", prefix = "http://schema.org/") %>%
  rdftools:::filter(author.familyName == "Boettiger",
         author.givenName == "Carl",
        prefix = "http://schema.org/") %>%
  rdftools:::sparql_build()

vos_query(con, query)
#>    identifier                                        license familyName
#> 1      RNeXML         https://spdx.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause       <NA>
#> 2       arkdb                  https://spdx.org/licenses/MIT       <NA>
#> 3   codemetar              https://spdx.org/licenses/GPL-3.0       <NA>
#> 4         EML https://spdx.org/licenses/BSD-2-Clause-FreeBSD       <NA>

    myserver$kill()
